block.p: Victoria Ann Radford, a daughter of Jane Radford of New York and Geoffrey Radford of Ponte Vedra, Fla., was married yesterday to Jonathan Cale Patricof, a son of Susan and Alan Patricof of New York. Rabbi Joel S. Goor performed the ceremony at the home of the bridegroom's parents in East Hampton, N.Y.

The bride, 25, was until last fall an account executive at Bragman, Nyman, Cafarelli, a public relations firm in Beverly Hills, Calif. She graduated from the University of Michigan. Her father, who is retired, was a professional tennis player and coach.

Victoria Ann Radford, a daughter of Jane Radford of New York and Geoffrey Radford of Ponte Vedra, Fla., was married yesterday to Jonathan Cale Patricof, a son of Susan and Alan Patricof of New York. Rabbi Joel S. Goor performed the ceremony at the home of the bridegroom's parents in East Hampton, N.Y.

The bride, 25, was until last fall an account executive at Bragman, Nyman, Cafarelli, a public relations firm in Beverly Hills, Calif. She graduated from the University of Michigan. Her father, who is retired, was a professional tennis player and coach.

The bridegroom, 27, is a candidate for an M.B.A. at Harvard University, from which he graduated magna cum laude. His father is the chairman of Patricof & Company Ventures, a venture capital firm in New York, and he was the chairman of the White House Conference on Small Business from 1993 to 1995. The bridegroom's mother, Susan Patricof, is the chairwoman of the Northside Center for Child Development in New York.
